intro: Synotis borii, commonly known as the alpine synotis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Siberia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Synotis borii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra habitats.
